44011012	The Spirit told me to go with them without wondering if it was all right . These six brothers here also went with me , and we went to the house of Cornelius .
44011013	He told us about the angel he had seen standing in his house . The angel said , ‘ Send some men to Joppa to get Simon , the one who is also called Peter .
44011014	He will speak to you , and what he tells you will save you and everyone living in your house . ’
44011015	“ After I began speaking , the Holy Spirit came on them just as he came on us at the beginning .
44011016	Then I remembered the words of the Lord Jesus : ‘ John baptized people in water , but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit . ’
44011017	God gave these people the same gift he gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ . So how could I object to what God wanted to do ? ”
44011018	When the Jewish believers heard this , they stopped arguing . They praised God and said , “ So God is also allowing even those who are not Jews to change their hearts so that they can have the life he gives ! ”
44011019	The believers were scattered by the persecution that began when Stephen was killed . Some of them went as far as Phoenicia , Cyprus , and Antioch . They told the Good News in these places , but only to Jews .
44011020	Some of these believers were men from Cyprus and Cyrene . When these men came to Antioch , they began speaking to people who were not Jews . They told them the Good News about the Lord Jesus .
44011021	The Lord was helping these men , and a large number of people believed and decided to follow the Lord .
44011022	When the church in Jerusalem heard about this , they sent Barnabas to Antioch .
44011025	Then Barnabas went to the city of Tarsus to look for Saul .
44011026	When he found him , he brought him to Antioch . They stayed there a whole year . Every time the church came together , Barnabas and Saul met with them and taught many people . It was in Antioch that the followers of the Lord Jesus were called “ Christ-followers ” for the first time .
44011027	About that same time some prophets went from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	One of them , named Agabus , stood up and spoke with the help of the Spirit . He said , “ A very bad time is coming to the whole world . There will be no food for people to eat . ” ( This time of famine happened when Claudius was emperor . )
44011029	The Lord’s followers decided that they would each send as much as they could to help their brothers and sisters who lived in Judea .
44011030	They gathered the money and gave it to Barnabas and Saul , who took it to the elders in Judea .
44012001	During this same time , King Herod began to do harm to some of those who were part of the church .
44012002	He ordered James , the brother of John , to be killed with a sword .
44012003	Herod saw that many of the Jews liked this , so he decided to arrest Peter too . This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread .
44012004	He arrested Peter and put him in jail , where he was guarded by a group of 16 soldiers . Herod planned to bring Peter before the people , but he wanted to wait until after the Passover festival .
44012005	So Peter was kept in jail , but the church was constantly praying to God for him .
44012006	One night , Peter , bound with two chains , was sleeping between two of the soldiers . More soldiers were guarding the door of the jail . Herod was planning to bring Peter out before the people the next day .
44012007	Suddenly an angel of the Lord was standing there , and the room was filled with light . The angel tapped Peter on the side and woke him up . The angel said , “ Hurry , get up ! ” The chains fell off Peter’s hands .
44012008	The angel said , “ Get dressed and put on your sandals . ” Peter did as he was told . Then the angel said , “ Put on your coat and follow me . ”
44012009	So the angel went out and Peter followed . He did not know if the angel was really doing this . He thought he might be seeing a vision .
44012010	Peter and the angel went past the first guard and the second guard . Then they came to the iron gate that separated them from the city . The gate opened for them by itself . After they went through the gate and walked about a block , the angel suddenly left .
44012011	Peter realized then what had happened . He thought , “ Now I know that the Lord really sent his angel to me . He rescued me from Herod and from everything those Jews thought would happen to me . ”
44012012	When Peter realized this , he went to the home of Mary , the mother of John , who was also called Mark . Many people were gathered there and were praying .
44012013	Peter knocked on the outside door . A servant girl named Rhoda came to answer it .
44012014	She recognized Peter’s voice , and she was very happy . She even forgot to open the door . She ran inside and told the group , “ Peter is at the door ! ”
44012015	The believers said to her , “ You are crazy ! ” But she continued to say that it was true . So they said , “ It must be Peter’s angel . ”
44012016	But Peter continued to knock . When the believers opened the door , they saw him . They were amazed .
44012017	Peter made a sign with his hand to tell them to be quiet . He explained to them how the Lord led him out of the jail . He said , “ Tell James and the other brothers what happened . ” Then he left and went to another place .
44012018	The next day the soldiers were very upset . They wondered what happened to Peter .
44012019	Herod looked everywhere for him but could not find him . So he questioned the guards and then ordered that they be killed . Later , Herod moved from Judea . He went to the city of Caesarea and stayed there a while .
44012020	Herod was very angry with the people from the cities of Tyre and Sidon . But these cities needed food from his country , so a group of them came to ask him for peace . They were able to get Blastus , the king’s personal servant , on their side .
44012021	Herod decided on a day to meet with them . On that day he was wearing a beautiful royal robe . He sat on his throne and made a speech to the people .
44012022	The people shouted , “ This is the voice of a god , not a man ! ”
44012023	Herod did not give the glory to God . So an angel of the Lord caused him to get sick . He was eaten by worms inside him , and he died .
44012024	The message of God was spreading , reaching more and more people .
44012025	After Barnabas and Saul finished their work in Jerusalem , they returned to Antioch , taking John Mark with them .
44013001	In the church at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers . They were Barnabas , Simeon ( also called Niger ) , Lucius ( from the city of Cyrene ) , Manaen ( who had grown up with King Herod ) , and Saul .
44013002	These men were all serving the Lord and fasting when the Holy Spirit said to them , “ Appoint Barnabas and Saul to do a special work for me . They are the ones I have chosen to do it . ”
44013003	So the church fasted and prayed . They laid their hands on Barnabas and Saul and sent them out .
44013004	Barnabas and Saul were sent out by the Holy Spirit . They went to the city of Seleucia . Then they sailed from there to the island of Cyprus .
44013005	When Barnabas and Saul came to the city of Salamis , they told the message of God in the Jewish synagogues . John Mark was with them to help .
44013006	They went across the whole island to the city of Paphos . There they met a Jewish man named Barjesus who did magic . He was a false prophet .
44013007	He always stayed close to Sergius Paulus , who was the governor and a very smart man . He invited Barnabas and Saul to come visit him , because he wanted to hear the message of God .
44013008	But the magician Elymas ( as Barjesus was called in Greek ) spoke against them , trying to stop the governor from believing in Jesus .
44013009	But Saul ( also known as Paul ) , filled with the Holy Spirit , looked hard at Elymas
44013010	and said , “ You son of the devil , full of lies and all kinds of evil tricks ! You are an enemy of everything that is right . Will you never stop trying to change the Lord’s truths into lies ?
44013011	Now the Lord will touch you and you will be blind . For a time you will not be able to see anything — not even the light from the sun . ” Then everything became dark for Elymas . He walked around lost . He was trying to find someone to lead him by the hand .
44013012	When the governor saw this , he believed . He was amazed at the teaching about the Lord .
44013013	Paul and the people with him sailed away from Paphos . They came to Perga , a city in Pamphylia . There John Mark left them and returned to Jerusalem .
44013014	They continued their trip from Perga and went to Antioch , a city near Pisidia . On the Sabbath day they went into the Jewish synagogue and sat down .
44013015	The Law of Moses and the writings of the prophets were read . Then the leaders of the synagogue sent a message to Paul and Barnabas : “ Brothers , if you have something to say that will help the people here , please speak . ”
44013016	Paul stood up , raised his hand to get their attention , and said , “ People of Israel and all you others who worship the true God , please listen to me !
44013017	The God of Israel chose our ancestors . And during the time our people lived in Egypt as foreigners , he made them great . Then he brought them out of that country with great power .
44013018	And he was patient with them for 40 years in the desert .
44013019	God destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan and gave their land to his people .
44013020	All this happened in about 450 years . “ After this , God gave our people judges until the time of Samuel the prophet .
44013021	Then the people asked for a king . God gave them Saul , the son of Kish . Saul was from the tribe of Benjamin . He was king for 40 years .
44013022	After God took Saul away , God made David their king . This is what God said about David : ‘ David , the son of Jesse , is the kind of person who does what pleases me . He will do everything I want him to do . ’
44013023	“ As he promised , God has brought one of David’s descendants to Israel to be their Savior . That descendant is Jesus .
44013024	Before he came , John told all the people of Israel what they should do . He told them to be baptized to show they wanted to change their lives .
44013025	When John was finishing his work , he said , ‘ Who do you think I am ? I am not the Messiah . He is coming later , and I am not worthy to be the slave who unties his sandals . ’
44013026	“ My brothers , sons in the family of Abraham , and you other people who also worship the true God , listen ! The news about this salvation has been sent to us .
44013027	The Jews living in Jerusalem and their leaders did not realize that Jesus was the Savior . The words the prophets wrote about him were read every Sabbath day , but they did not understand . They condemned Jesus . When they did this , they made the words of the prophets come true .
44013028	They could not find any real reason why Jesus should die , but they asked Pilate to kill him .
44013029	“ These Jews did all the bad things that the Scriptures said would happen to Jesus . Then they took Jesus down from the cross and put him in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised him up from death !
44013031	After this , for many days , those who had gone with Jesus from Galilee to Jerusalem saw him . They are now his witnesses to our people .
44013032	“ We tell you the Good News about the promise God made to our ancestors .
44013033	We are their descendants , and God has made this promise come true for us . God did this by raising Jesus from death . We also read about this in Psalm 2 : ‘ You are my Son . Today I have become your Father . ’ ‘ I will give you the true and holy promises that I made to David . ’ ‘ You will not let your Holy One rot in the grave . ’
44013041	‘ Listen , you people who doubt ! You can wonder , but then go away and die ; because during your time , I will do something that you will not believe . You will not believe it , even if someone explains it to you ! ’ ”
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue , the people asked them to come again on the next Sabbath day and tell them more about these things .
44013043	After the meeting , many of the people followed Paul and Barnabas , including many Jews and people who had changed their religion to be like Jews and worship the true God . Paul and Barnabas encouraged them to continue trusting in God’s grace .
44013044	On the next Sabbath day , almost all the people in the city came together to hear the word of the Lord .
44013045	When the Jews there saw all these people , they became very jealous . Shouting insults , they argued against everything Paul said .
44013046	But Paul and Barnabas spoke very boldly . They said , “ We had to tell God’s message to you Jews first , but you refuse to listen . You have made it clear that you are not worthy of having eternal life . So we will now go to those who are not Jews .
44013047	This is what the Lord told us to do : ‘ I have made you a light for the other nations , to show people all over the world the way to be saved . ’ ”
44013048	When the non-Jewish people heard Paul say this , they were happy . They gave honor to the message of the Lord , and many of them believed it . These were the ones chosen to have eternal life .
44013049	And so the message of the Lord was being told throughout the whole country .
44013050	But the Jews there caused some of the important religious women and the leaders of the city to be angry and turn against Paul and Barnabas and throw them out of town .
44013051	So Paul and Barnabas shook the dust off their feet . Then they went to the city of Iconium .
44013052	But the Lord’s followers in Antioch were happy and filled with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	Paul and Barnabas went to the city of Iconium . As they did in Antioch , they entered the Jewish synagogue . They spoke to the people there . They spoke so well that many Jews and Greeks believed what they said .
44014002	But some of the Jews did not believe . They said things that caused the non-Jewish people to be angry and turn against the believers .
44014003	So Paul and Barnabas stayed in Iconium a long time , and they spoke bravely for the Lord . They told the people about God’s grace . The Lord proved that what they said was true by causing miraculous signs and wonders to be done through them .
44014004	But some of the people in the city agreed with the Jews who did not believe Paul and Barnabas . Others followed the apostles . So the city was divided .
44014005	Some of the Jews there , as well as their leaders and some of the non-Jewish people , were determined to hurt Paul and Barnabas . They wanted to stone them to death .
44014006	When Paul and Barnabas learned about this , they left the city . They went to Lystra and Derbe , cities in Lycaonia , and to the surrounding areas .
44014007	They told the Good News there too .
44014008	In Lystra there was a man who had something wrong with his feet . He had been born crippled and had never walked .
44014009	He was sitting and listening to Paul speak . Paul looked straight at him and saw that the man believed God could heal him .
44014010	So Paul shouted , “ Stand up on your feet ! ” The man jumped up and began walking around .
44014011	When the people saw what Paul did , they shouted in their own Lycaonian language . They said , “ The gods have come down to us in the form of humans ! ”
44014012	The people began to call Barnabas “ Zeus , ” and they called Paul “ Hermes , ” because he was the main speaker .
44014013	The temple of Zeus was near the city . The priest of this temple brought some bulls and flowers to the city gates . The priest and the people wanted to offer a sacrifice to Paul and Barnabas .
44014014	But when the apostles , Barnabas and Paul , understood what the people were doing , they tore their own clothes . Then they ran in among the people and shouted to them :
44014015	“ Men , why are you doing this ? We are not gods . We are human just like you . We came to tell you the Good News . We are telling you to turn away from these worthless things . Turn to the true living God , the one who made the sky , the earth , the sea , and everything that is in them .
44014016	“ In the past God let all the nations do what they wanted .
44014017	But God was always there doing the good things that prove he is real . He gives you rain from heaven and good harvests at the right times . He gives you plenty of food and fills your hearts with joy . ”
44014018	Even after saying all this , Paul and Barnabas still could hardly stop the people from offering sacrifices to them .
44014019	Then some Jews came from Antioch and Iconium and persuaded the people to turn against Paul . So they threw stones at him and dragged him out of the town . They thought they had killed him .
44014020	But when the followers of Jesus gathered around him , he got up and went back into the town . The next day he and Barnabas left and went to the city of Derbe .
44014021	They also told the Good News in the city of Derbe , and many people became followers of Jesus . Then Paul and Barnabas returned to the cities of Lystra , Iconium , and Antioch .
44014022	In those cities they helped the followers grow stronger in their faith and encouraged them to continue trusting God . They told them , “ We must suffer many things on our way into God’s kingdom . ”
44014023	They also chose elders for each church and stopped eating for a period of time to pray for them . These elders were men who had put their trust in the Lord Jesus , so Paul and Barnabas put them in his care .
44014024	Paul and Barnabas went through the country of Pisidia . Then they came to the country of Pamphylia .
44014025	They told people the message of God in the city of Perga , and then they went down to the city of Attalia .
44014026	And from there they sailed away to Antioch in Syria . This is the city where the believers had put them into God’s care and sent them to do this work . Now they had finished it .
44014027	When Paul and Barnabas arrived , they gathered the church together . They told them everything God had used them to do . They said , “ God opened a door for the non-Jewish people to believe ! ”
44014028	And they stayed there a long time with the Lord’s followers .
44015001	Then some men came to Antioch from Judea and began teaching the non-Jewish believers : “ You cannot be saved if you are not circumcised as Moses taught us . ”
44015002	Paul and Barnabas were against this teaching and argued with these men about it . So the group decided to send Paul , Barnabas , and some others to Jerusalem to talk more about this with the apostles and elders .
44015003	The church helped them get ready to leave on their trip . The men went through the countries of Phoenicia and Samaria , where they told all about how the non-Jewish people had turned to the true God . This made all the believers very happy .
44015004	When the men arrived in Jerusalem , the apostles , the elders , and the whole church welcomed them . Paul , Barnabas , and the others told about all that God had done with them .
44015005	Some of the believers in Jerusalem had belonged to the Pharisees . They stood up and said , “ The non-Jewish believers must be circumcised . We must tell them to obey the Law of Moses ! ”
44015006	Then the apostles and the elders gathered to study this problem .
44015007	After a long debate , Peter stood up and said to them , “ My brothers , I am sure you remember what happened in the early days . God chose me from among you to tell the Good News to those who are not Jewish . It was from me that they heard the Good News and believed .
44015008	God knows everyone , even their thoughts , and he accepted these non-Jewish people . He showed this to us by giving them the Holy Spirit the same as he did to us .
44015009	To God , those people are not different from us . When they believed , God made their hearts pure .
44015010	So now , why are you putting a heavy burden around the necks of the non-Jewish followers of Jesus ? Are you trying to make God angry ? We and our fathers were not able to carry that burden .
44015011	No , we believe that we and these people will be saved the same way — by the grace of the Lord Jesus . ”
44015012	Then the whole group became quiet . They listened while Paul and Barnabas told about all the miraculous signs and wonders that God had done through them among the non-Jewish people .
44015013	When they finished speaking , James said , “ My brothers , listen to me .
44015014	Simon Peter has told us how God showed his love for the non-Jewish people . For the first time , God accepted them and made them his people .
44015015	The words of the prophets agree with this too :
44015016	‘ I will return after this . I will build David’s house again . It has fallen down . I will build again the parts of his house that have been pulled down . I will make his house new .
44015017	Then the rest of the world will look for the Lord God — all those of other nations who are my people too . The Lord said this . And he is the one who does all these things . ’
44015018	‘ All this has been known from the beginning of time . ’
44015019	“ So I think we should not make things hard for those who have turned to God from among the non-Jewish people .
44015020	Instead , we should send a letter telling them only the things they should not do :
44015022	The apostles , the elders , and the whole church wanted to send some men with Paul and Barnabas to Antioch . The group decided to choose some of their own men . They chose Judas ( also called Barsabbas ) and Silas , men who were respected by the believers .
44015023	The group sent the letter with these men . The letter said :
44015030	So Paul , Barnabas , Judas , and Silas left Jerusalem and went to Antioch . There they gathered the group of believers together and gave them the letter .
44015031	When the believers read it , they were happy . The letter comforted them .
44015032	Judas and Silas , who were also prophets , said many things to encourage the believers and make them stronger in their faith .
44015033	After Judas and Silas stayed there for a while , they left . They received a blessing of peace from the believers . Then they went back to those who had sent them .
44015035	But Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch . They and many others taught the believers and told other people the Good News about the Lord .
44015036	A few days later , Paul said to Barnabas , “ We should go back to all the towns where we told people the message of the Lord . We should visit the believers to see how they are doing . ”
44015037	Barnabas wanted to bring John Mark with them too .
44015038	But on their first trip John Mark did not continue with them in the work . He had left them at Pamphylia . So Paul did not think it was a good idea to take him this time .
44015039	Paul and Barnabas had a big argument about this . It was so bad that they separated and went different ways . Barnabas sailed to Cyprus and took Mark with him .
44015040	Paul chose Silas to go with him . The believers in Antioch put Paul into the Lord’s care and sent him out .
44015041	Paul and Silas went through the countries of Syria and Cilicia , helping the churches grow stronger .
44016001	Paul went to the city of Derbe and then to Lystra , where a follower of Jesus named Timothy lived . Timothy’s mother was a Jewish believer , but his father was a Greek .
44016002	The believers in the cities of Lystra and Iconium had only good things to say about him .
44016003	Paul wanted Timothy to travel with him , but all the Jews living in that area knew that his father was a Greek . So Paul circumcised Timothy to please the Jews .
44016004	Then Paul and those with him traveled through other cities . They gave the believers the rules and decisions from the apostles and elders in Jerusalem . They told them to obey these rules .
44016005	So the churches were becoming stronger in their faith , and the number of believers was growing every day .
44016006	Paul and those with him went through the areas of Phrygia and Galatia because the Holy Spirit did not allow them to tell the Good News in the province of Asia .
44016007	When they reached the border of Mysia , they tried to go on into Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus did not let them go there .
44016008	So they passed by Mysia and went to the city of Troas .
44016009	That night Paul saw a vision . In it , a man from Macedonia came to Paul . The man stood there and begged , “ Come across to Macedonia and help us . ”
44016010	After Paul had seen the vision , we immediately prepared to leave for Macedonia . We understood that God had called us to tell the Good News to those people .
44016011	We left Troas in a ship and sailed to the island of Samothrace . The next day we sailed to the city of Neapolis .
44016012	Then we went to Philippi , a Roman colony and the leading city in that part of Macedonia . We stayed there for a few days .
44016013	On the Sabbath day we went out the city gate to the river . There we thought we might find a special place for prayer . Some women had gathered there , so we sat down and talked with them .
44016014	There was a woman there named Lydia from the city of Thyatira . Her job was selling purple cloth . She was a worshiper of the true God . Lydia was listening to Paul , and the Lord opened her heart to accept what Paul was saying .
44016015	She and all the people living in her house were baptized . Then she invited us into her home . She said , “ If you think I am a true believer in the Lord Jesus , come stay in my house . ” She persuaded us to stay with her .
44016016	One day we were going to the place for prayer , and a servant girl met us . She had a spirit in her that gave her the power to tell what would happen in the future . By doing this she earned a lot of money for the men who owned her .
44016017	She started following Paul and the rest of us around . She kept shouting , “ These men are servants of the Most High God ! They are telling you how you can be saved ! ”
44016018	She continued doing this for many days . This bothered Paul , so he turned and said to the spirit , “ By the power of Jesus Christ , I command you to come out of her ! ” Immediately , the spirit came out .
44016019	When the men who owned the servant girl saw this , they realized that they could no longer use her to make money . So they grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them to the public square to meet with the authorities .
44016020	They brought Paul and Silas before the Roman officials and said , “ These men are Jews , and they are making trouble in our city .
44016021	They are telling people to do things that are not right for us as Romans to do . ”
44016022	The whole crowd turned against Paul and Silas . The officials tore the clothes off both men and ordered that they be beaten with rods .
44016023	They were beaten severely and thrown into jail . The officials told the jailer , “ Guard them very carefully ! ”
44016024	When the jailer heard this special order , he put Paul and Silas far inside the jail and bound their feet between large blocks of wood .
44016025	About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing songs to God . The other prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	Suddenly there was an earthquake so strong that it shook the foundation of the jail . All the doors of the jail opened , and the chains on all the prisoners fell off .
44016027	The jailer woke up and saw that the jail doors were open . He thought that the prisoners had already escaped , so he got his sword and was ready to kill himself .
44016028	But Paul shouted , “ Don’t hurt yourself ! We are all here ! ”
44016029	The jailer told someone to bring a light . Then he ran inside and , shaking with fear , fell down in front of Paul and Silas .
44016030	Then he brought them outside and said , “ Men , what must I do to be saved ? ”
44016031	They said to him , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved — you and all who live in your house . ”
44016032	So Paul and Silas told the message of the Lord to the jailer and all the people who lived in his house .
44016033	It was late at night , but the jailer took Paul and Silas and washed their wounds . Then the jailer and all his people were baptized .
44016034	After this the jailer took Paul and Silas home and gave them some food . All the people were very happy because they now believed in God .
44016035	The next morning the Roman officials sent some soldiers to tell the jailer , “ Let these men go free . ”
44016036	The jailer said to Paul , “ The officials have sent these soldiers to let you go free . You can leave now . Go in peace . ”
44016037	But Paul said to the soldiers , “ Those officials did not prove that we did anything wrong , but they beat us in public and put us in jail . And we are Roman citizens . Now they want us to go away quietly . No , they must come here themselves and lead us out ! ”
44016038	The soldiers told the officials what Paul said . When they heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens , they were afraid .
44016039	So they came and told them they were sorry . They led them out of the jail and asked them to leave the city .
44016040	But when Paul and Silas came out of the jail , they went to Lydia’s house . They saw some of the believers there and encouraged them . Then they left .
44017001	Paul and Silas traveled through the cities of Amphipolis and Apollonia . They came to the city of Thessalonica , where there was a Jewish synagogue .
44017002	Paul went into the synagogue to see the Jews as he always did . The next three weeks , on each Sabbath day , he discussed the Scriptures with them .
44017003	He explained the Scriptures to show them that the Messiah had to die and then rise from death . He said , “ This Jesus that I am telling you about is the Messiah . ”
44017004	Some of the Jews there believed Paul and Silas and decided to join them . Also , a large number of Greeks who were worshipers of the true God and many important women joined them .
44017005	But the Jews who did not believe became jealous , so they got some bad men from around the city center to make trouble . They formed a mob and caused a riot in the city . They went to Jason’s house , looking for Paul and Silas . They wanted to bring them out before the people .
44017006	When they did not find them , they dragged Jason and some of the other believers to the city leaders . The people shouted , “ These men have made trouble everywhere in the world , and now they have come here too !
44017007	Jason is keeping them in his house . They all do things against the laws of Caesar . They say there is another king called Jesus . ”
44017008	When the city leaders and the other people heard this , they became very upset .
44017009	They made Jason and the other believers deposit money to guarantee that there would be no more trouble . Then they let them go .
44017010	That same night the believers sent Paul and Silas to another city named Berea . When they arrived there , they went to the Jewish synagogue .
44017011	The people in Berea were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica . They were so glad to hear the message Paul told them . They studied the Scriptures every day to make sure that what they heard was really true .
44017012	The result was that many of them believed , including many important Greek women and men .
44017013	But when the Jews in Thessalonica learned that Paul was telling people God’s message in Berea , they came there too . They upset the people and made trouble .
44017014	So the believers immediately sent Paul away to the coast , but Silas and Timothy stayed in Berea .
44017015	Those who went with Paul took him to the city of Athens . They returned with a message for Silas and Timothy to come and join him as soon as they could .
44017016	While Paul was waiting for Silas and Timothy in Athens , he was upset because he saw that the city was full of idols .
44017017	In the synagogue he talked with the Jews and with the Greeks who were worshipers of the true God . He also went to the public square every day and talked with everyone who came by .
44017018	Some of the Epicurean and some of the Stoic philosophers argued with him . Some of them said , “ This man doesn’t really know what he is talking about . What is he trying to say ? ” Paul was telling them the Good News about Jesus and the resurrection . So they said , “ He seems to be telling us about some other gods . ”
44017019	They took Paul to a meeting of the Areopagus council . They said , “ Please explain to us this new idea that you have been teaching .
44017020	The things you are saying are new to us . We have never heard this teaching before , and we want to know what it means . ”
44017021	( The people of Athens and the foreigners who lived there spent all their time either telling or listening to all the latest ideas . )
44017022	Then Paul stood up before the meeting of the Areopagus council and said , “ Men of Athens , everything I see here tells me you are very religious .
44017023	I was going through your city and I saw the things you worship . I found an altar that had these words written on it : ‘ to an unknown god . ’ You worship a god that you don’t know . This is the God I want to tell you about .
44017024	“ He is the God who made the whole world and everything in it . He is the Lord of the land and the sky . He does not live in temples built by human hands .
44017025	He is the one who gives people life , breath , and everything else they need . He does not need any help from them . He has everything he needs .
44017026	God began by making one man , and from him he made all the different people who live everywhere in the world . He decided exactly when and where they would live .
44017027	“ God wanted people to look for him , and perhaps in searching all around for him , they would find him . But he is not far from any of us .
44017028	It is through him that we are able to live , to do what we do , and to be who we are . As your own poets have said , ‘ We all come from him . ’
44017029	“ That’s right . We all come from God . So you must not think that he is like something people imagine or make . He is not made of gold , silver , or stone .
44017030	In the past people did not understand God , and he overlooked this . But now he is telling everyone in the world to change and turn to him .
44017031	He has decided on a day when he will judge all the people in the world in a way that is fair . To do this he will use a man he chose long ago . And he has proved to everyone that this is the man to do it . He proved it by raising him from death ! ”
44017032	When the people heard about Jesus being raised from death , some of them laughed . But others said , “ We will hear more about this from you later . ”
44017033	So Paul left the council meeting .
44017034	But some of the people joined with Paul and became believers . Among these were Dionysius , a member of the Areopagus council , a woman named Damaris , and some others .
44018001	Later , Paul left Athens and went to the city of Corinth .
44018002	There he met a Jewish man named Aquila , who was born in the country of Pontus . But he and his wife , Priscilla , had recently moved to Corinth from Italy . They left Italy because Claudius had given an order for all Jews to leave Rome . Paul went to visit Aquila and Priscilla .
44018003	They were tentmakers , the same as Paul , so he stayed with them and worked with them .
44018004	Every Sabbath day Paul went to the synagogue and talked with both Jews and Greeks , trying to persuade them to believe in Jesus .
44018005	But after Silas and Timothy came from Macedonia , Paul spent all his time telling God’s message to the Jews , trying to convince them that Jesus is the Messiah .
44018006	But they disagreed with what Paul was teaching and started insulting him . So Paul shook the dust from his clothes . He said to them , “ If you are not saved , it will be your own fault ! I have done all I can do . After this I will go only to the non-Jewish people . ”
44018007	Paul left the synagogue and moved into the home of Titius Justus , a man who was a worshiper of the true God . His house was next to the synagogue .
44018008	Crispus was the leader of that synagogue . He and all the people living in his house believed in the Lord Jesus . Many other people in Corinth also listened to Paul . They , too , believed and were baptized .
44018009	During the night , Paul had a vision . The Lord said to him , “ Don’t be afraid , and don’t stop talking to people .
44018010	I am with you , and no one will be able to hurt you . Many of my people are in this city . ”
44018011	Paul stayed there for a year and a half teaching God’s message to the people .
44018012	During the time that Gallio was the governor of Achaia , some of the Jews came together against Paul . They took him to court .
44018013	They said to Gallio , “ This man is teaching people to worship God in a way that is against our law ! ”
44018014	Paul was ready to say something , but Gallio spoke to the Jews . He said , “ I would listen to you if your complaint was about a crime or other wrong .
44018015	But it is only about words and names — arguments about your own law . So you must solve this problem yourselves . I don’t want to be a judge of these matters . ”
44018016	So Gallio made them leave the court .
44018017	Then they all grabbed Sosthenes , the leader of the synagogue . They beat him before the court . But this did not bother Gallio .
44018018	Paul stayed with the believers for many days . Then he left and sailed for Syria . Priscilla and Aquila were also with him . At Cenchrea Paul cut off his hair , because he had made a promise to God .
44018019	Then they went to the city of Ephesus , where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila . While Paul was in Ephesus , he went into the synagogue and talked with the Jews .
44018020	They asked him to stay longer , but he refused .
44018021	He left them and said , “ I will come back to you again if God wants me to . ” And so he sailed away from Ephesus .
44018022	When Paul arrived at Caesarea , he went to Jerusalem and visited the church there . After that he went to Antioch .
44018023	Paul stayed in Antioch for a while . Then he left there and went through the countries of Galatia and Phrygia . He traveled from town to town in these countries , helping all the followers of Jesus grow stronger in their faith .
44018024	A Jew named Apollos came to Ephesus . Born in the city of Alexandria , he was an educated man who knew the Scriptures well .
44018025	He had been taught about the Lord and was always excited to talk to people about Jesus . What he taught was right , but the only baptism he knew about was the baptism that John taught .
44018026	Apollos began to speak very boldly in the synagogue . When Priscilla and Aquila heard him speak , they took him to their home and helped him understand the way of God better .
44018027	Apollos wanted to go to Achaia . So the believers in Ephesus helped him . They wrote a letter to the Lord’s followers in Achaia and asked them to accept Apollos . When he arrived there , he was a great help to those who had believed in Jesus because of God’s grace .
44018028	He argued very strongly against the Jews before all the people . He clearly proved that the Jews were wrong . He used the Scriptures and showed that Jesus is the Messiah .
44019001	While Apollos was in the city of Corinth , Paul was visiting some places on his way to Ephesus . In Ephesus he found some other followers of the Lord .
44019002	He asked them , “ Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed ? ” These followers said to him , “ We have never even heard of a Holy Spirit ! ”
44019003	Paul asked them , “ So what kind of baptism did you have ? ” They said , “ It was the baptism that John taught . ”
44019004	Paul said , “ John told people to be baptized to show they wanted to change their lives . He told people to believe in the one who would come after him , and that one is Jesus . ”
44019005	When these followers heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	Then Paul laid his hands on them , and the Holy Spirit came on them . They began speaking different languages and prophesying .
44019007	There were about twelve men in this group .
44019008	Paul went into the synagogue and spoke very boldly . He continued doing this for three months . He talked with the Jews , trying to persuade them to accept what he was telling them about God’s kingdom .
44019009	But some of them became stubborn and refused to believe . In front of everyone , they said bad things about the Way . So Paul left these Jews and took the Lord’s followers with him . He went to a place where a man named Tyrannus had a school . There Paul talked with people every day .
44019010	He did this for two years . Because of this work , everyone in Asia , Jews and Greeks , heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God used Paul to do some very special miracles .
44019012	Some people carried away handkerchiefs and clothes that Paul had used and put them on those who were sick . The sick people were healed , and evil spirits left them .
44019015	But one time an evil spirit said to these Jews , “ I know Jesus , and I know about Paul , but who are you ? ”
44019016	Then the man who had the evil spirit inside him jumped on these Jews . He was much stronger than all of them . He beat them up and tore their clothes off . They all ran away from that house .
44019017	All the people in Ephesus , Jews and Greeks , learned about this . They were all filled with fear and gave great honor to the Lord Jesus .
44019018	Many of the believers began to confess , telling about all the evil things they had done .
44019019	Some of them had used magic . These believers brought their magic books and burned them before everyone . These books were worth about 50,000 silver coins .
44019020	This is how the word of the Lord was spreading in a powerful way , causing more and more people to believe .
44019021	After this , Paul made plans to go to Jerusalem . He planned to go through the regions of Macedonia and Achaia , and then go to Jerusalem . He thought , “ After I visit Jerusalem , I must also visit Rome . ”
44019022	Timothy and Erastus were two of his helpers . Paul sent them ahead to Macedonia . But he stayed in Asia for a while .
44019023	But during that time there was some trouble in Ephesus about the Way . This is how it all happened :
44019024	There was a man named Demetrius . He worked with silver . He made little silver models that looked like the temple of the goddess Artemis . The men who did this work made a lot of money .
44019025	Demetrius had a meeting with these men and some others who did the same kind of work . He told them , “ Men , you know that we make a lot of money from our business .
44019026	But look at what this man Paul is doing . Listen to what he is saying . He has convinced many people in Ephesus and all over Asia to change their religion . He says the gods that people make by hand are not real .
44019027	I’m afraid this is going to turn people against our business . But there is also another problem . People will begin to think that the temple of the great goddess Artemis is not important . Her greatness will be destroyed . And Artemis is the goddess that everyone in Asia and the whole world worships . ”
44019028	When the men heard this , they became very angry . They shouted , “ Great is Artemis , the goddess of Ephesus ! ”
44019029	The whole city was thrown into confusion . The people grabbed Gaius and Aristarchus , men from Macedonia who were traveling with Paul , and rushed all together into the stadium .
44019030	Paul wanted to go in and talk to the people , but the Lord’s followers did not let him go .
44019031	Also , some leaders of the country who were friends of Paul sent him a message telling him not to go into the stadium .
44019032	Some people were shouting one thing and others were shouting something else . The meeting was very confused . Most of the people did not know why they had come there .
44019033	Some Jews made a man named Alexander stand before the crowd , and they told him what to say . Alexander waved his hand , trying to explain things to the people .
44019034	But when the people saw that Alexander was a Jew , they all began shouting the same thing . For two hours they continued shouting , “ Great is Artemis of Ephesus ! Great is Artemis of Ephesus ! Great is Artemis … ! ”
44019035	Then the city clerk persuaded the people to be quiet . He said , “ Men of Ephesus , everyone knows that Ephesus is the city that keeps the temple of the great goddess Artemis . Everyone knows that we also keep her holy rock .
44019036	No one can deny this , so you should be quiet . You must stop and think before you do anything else .
44019037	“ You brought these men here , but they have not said anything bad against our goddess . They have not stolen anything from her temple .
44019038	We have courts of law and there are judges . Do Demetrius and those men who work with him have a charge against anyone ? They should go to the courts . Let them argue with each other there .
44019039	“ Is there something else you want to talk about ? Then come to the regular town meeting of the people . It can be decided there .
44019040	I say this because someone might see this trouble today and say we are rioting . We could not explain all this trouble , because there is no real reason for this meeting . ”
44019041	After the city clerk said this , he told the people to go home .
44020001	When the trouble stopped , Paul invited the Lord’s followers to come visit him . After encouraging them , he told them goodbye and left for Macedonia .
44020002	On his way through Macedonia he had many words of encouragement for the followers in various places . Then he went to Greece
44020003	and stayed there three months . Paul was ready to sail for Syria , but some Jews were planning something against him . So he decided to go back through Macedonia to Syria .
44020004	These men were traveling with him : Sopater , the son of Pyrrhus , from the city of Berea ; Aristarchus and Secundus , from the city of Thessalonica ; Gaius , from the city of Derbe ; Timothy ; and two men from Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
44020005	These men went first , ahead of Paul . They waited for us in the city of Troas .
44020006	We sailed from the city of Philippi after the Festival of Unleavened Bread . We met these men in Troas five days later and stayed there seven days .
44020007	On Sunday we all met together to eat the Lord’s Supper . Paul talked to the group . Because he was planning to leave the next day , he continued talking until midnight .
44020008	We were all together in a room upstairs , and there were many lights in the room .
44020009	There was a young man named Eutychus sitting in the window . Paul continued talking , and Eutychus became very , very sleepy . Finally , he went to sleep and fell out of the window . He fell to the ground from the third floor . When the people went down and lifted him up , he was dead .
44020010	Paul went down to where Eutychus was , knelt down beside him , and put his arms around him . He said to the other believers , “ Don’t worry . He is alive now . ”
44020011	Then Paul went upstairs again , broke off some pieces of bread and ate . He spoke to them a long time . It was early morning when he finished , and then he left .
44020012	The Lord’s followers took Eutychus home alive , and they were all greatly comforted .
44020013	We went on ahead of Paul and sailed for the city of Assos , planning to meet him there . This is what he told us to do because he wanted to go by land .
44020014	When he caught up with us at Assos , we took him on board , and we all sailed to Mitylene .
44020015	The next day , we sailed away from there and came to a place near the island of Chios . Then the next day , we sailed to the island of Samos . A day later , we came to the city of Miletus .
44020016	Paul had already decided not to stop at Ephesus . He did not want to stay too long in Asia . He was hurrying because he wanted to be in Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost if possible .
44020017	In Miletus Paul sent a message back to Ephesus , telling the elders of the church in Ephesus to come to him .
44020018	When they came , Paul said to them , “ You know about my life from the first day I came to Asia . You know the way I lived all the time I was with you .
44020019	The Jews planned things against me , and this gave me much trouble . But you know that I always served the Lord , sometimes with tears . I never thought about myself first .
44020020	I always did what was best for you . I told you the Good News about Jesus in public before the people and also taught in your homes .
44020021	I told everyone — Jewish and non-Jewish people — to change and turn to God . I told them all to believe in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	“ But now I must obey the Spirit and go to Jerusalem . I don’t know what will happen to me there .
44020023	I know only that in every city the Holy Spirit tells me that troubles and even jail wait for me .
44020024	I don’t care about my own life . The most important thing is that I finish my work . I want to finish the work that the Lord Jesus gave me to do — to tell people the Good News about God’s grace .
44020025	“ And now listen to me . I know that none of you will ever see me again . All the time I was with you , I told you the Good News about God’s kingdom .
44020026	So today I can tell you one thing that I am sure of : God will not blame me if some of you are not saved .
44020027	I can say this because I know that I told you everything that God wants you to know .
44020028	Be careful for yourselves and for all the people God has given you . The Holy Spirit gave you the work of caring for this flock . You must be shepherds to the church of God , the people he bought with his own blood .
44020029	I know that after I leave , some men will come into your group . They will be like wild wolves and will try to destroy the flock .
44020030	Also , men from your own group will begin to teach things that are wrong . They will lead some of the Lord’s followers away from the truth to follow them .
44020031	So be careful ! And always remember what I did during the three years I was with you . I never stopped reminding each one of you how you should live , counseling you day and night and crying over you .
44020032	“ Now I am putting you in God’s care . I am depending on the message about his grace to make you strong . That message is able to give you the blessings that God gives to all his holy people .
44020033	When I was with you , I never wanted anyone’s money or fine clothes .
44020034	You know that I always worked to take care of my own needs and the needs of the people who were with me .
44020035	I always showed you that you should work just as I did and help people who are weak . I taught you to remember the words of the Lord Jesus : ‘ You will have a greater blessing when you give than when you receive . ’ ”
44020036	When Paul finished speaking , he knelt down , and they all prayed together .
44021001	After we said goodbye to the elders , we sailed away straight to Cos island . The next day we went to the island of Rhodes , and from there we went to Patara .
44021002	There we found a ship that was going to the area of Phoenicia . We got on the ship and sailed away .
44021003	We sailed near the island of Cyprus . We could see it on the north side , but we did not stop . We sailed to the country of Syria . We stopped at Tyre because the ship needed to unload its cargo there .
44021004	We found the Lord’s followers there and stayed with them for seven days . They warned Paul not to go to Jerusalem because of what the Spirit had told them .
44021005	But when our time there was up , we returned to the ship to continue our trip . All the followers , even the women and children , came with us to the seashore . We all knelt down on the beach , prayed ,
44021006	and said goodbye . Then we got on the ship , and the followers went home .
44021007	We continued our trip from Tyre and went to the city of Ptolemais . We greeted the believers there and stayed with them one day .
44021008	The next day we left Ptolemais and went to the city of Caesarea . We went into the home of Philip and stayed with him . He had the work of telling the Good News . He was one of the seven helpers .
44021009	He had four unmarried daughters who had the gift of prophesying .
44021010	After we had been there for several days , a prophet named Agabus came from Judea .
44021011	He came to us and borrowed Paul’s belt . He used it to tie his own hands and feet . He said , “ The Holy Spirit tells me , ‘ This is how the Jews in Jerusalem will tie up the man who wears this belt . Then they will hand him over to people who don’t know God . ’ ”
44021012	When we heard this , we and the other followers there begged Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021013	But he said , “ Why are you crying and making me feel so sad ? I am willing to be put in jail in Jerusalem . I am even ready to die for the name of the Lord Jesus ! ”
44021014	We could not persuade him to stay away from Jerusalem . So we stopped begging him and said , “ We pray that what the Lord wants will be done . ”
44021015	After this , we got ready and left for Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the followers of Jesus from Caesarea went with us . These followers took us to the home of Mnason , a man from Cyprus , who was one of the first people to be a follower of Jesus . They took us to his home so that we could stay with him .
44021017	The brothers and sisters in Jerusalem were very happy to see us .
44021018	The next day Paul went with us to visit James , and all the elders were there .
44021019	After greeting them , Paul told them point by point all that God had used him to do among the non-Jewish people .
44021020	When the leaders heard this , they praised God . Then they said to Paul , “ Brother , you can see that thousands of Jews have become believers , but they think it is very important to obey the Law of Moses .
44021021	They have been told that you teach the Jews who live in non-Jewish regions to stop following the Law of Moses . They have heard that you tell them not to circumcise their sons or follow our other customs .
44021022	“ What should we do ? The Jewish believers here will learn that you have come .
44021023	So we will tell you what to do : Four of our men have made a vow to God .
44021024	Take these men with you and share in their cleansing ceremony . Pay their expenses so that they can shave their heads . This will prove to everyone that the things they have heard about you are not true . They will see that you obey the Law of Moses in your own life .
44021025	“ In regard to the non-Jewish believers , we have already sent a letter to them saying what we think they should do :
44021026	So Paul took the four men with him . The next day he shared in their cleansing ceremony . Then he went to the Temple area and announced the time when the days of the cleansing ceremony would be finished . On the last day an offering would be given for each of the men .
44021027	When the seven-day period was almost finished , some Jews from Asia saw Paul in the Temple area . They stirred up everyone into an angry mob . They grabbed Paul
44021028	and shouted , “ Men of Israel , help us ! This is the man who is teaching things that are against the Law of Moses , against our people , and against this Temple of ours . This is what he teaches people everywhere . And now he has brought some Greeks into the Temple area and has made this holy place unclean ! ”
44021029	( The Jews said this because they had seen Trophimus with Paul in Jerusalem . Trophimus was a man from Ephesus . The Jews thought that Paul had taken him into the holy area of the Temple . )
44021030	An angry reaction spread throughout the city , and everyone came running to the Temple . They grabbed Paul and dragged him out of the holy area , and the gates were closed immediately .
44021031	While they were trying to kill Paul , the commander of the Roman army in Jerusalem got word that the whole city was in a state of riot .
44021032	Immediately the commander ran to where the crowd had gathered , taking with him some army officers and soldiers . When the people saw the commander and his soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	The commander went over to Paul and arrested him . He told his soldiers to tie him up with two chains . Then he asked , “ Who is this man ? What has he done wrong ? ”
44021034	Some people there were shouting one thing , and others were shouting something else . Because of all this confusion and shouting , the commander could not learn the truth about what had happened . So he told the soldiers to take Paul to the army building .
44021037	When the soldiers were ready to take Paul into the army building , he asked the commander , “ Can I say something to you ? ” The commander said , “ Oh , you speak Greek ?
44021038	Then you are not the man I thought you were . I thought you were the Egyptian who started some trouble against the government not long ago and led four thousand terrorists out to the desert . ”
44021039	Paul said , “ No , I am a Jew from Tarsus in the country of Cilicia . I am a citizen of that important city . Please , let me speak to the people . ”
44021040	The commander told Paul he could speak . So he stood on the steps and waved his hand so that the people would be quiet . The people became quiet and Paul spoke to them in Aramaic .
44022001	Paul said , “ My brothers and fathers , listen to me ! I will make my defense to you . ”
44022002	When the Jews heard Paul speaking Aramaic , they became very quiet . Then Paul said ,
44022003	“ I am a Jew , born in Tarsus in the country of Cilicia . I grew up in this city . I was a student of Gamaliel , who carefully taught me everything about the law of our fathers . I was very serious about serving God , the same as all of you here today .
44022004	I persecuted the people who followed the Way . Some of them were killed because of me . I arrested men and women and put them in jail .
44022005	“ The high priest and the whole council of older Jewish leaders can tell you that this is true . One time these leaders gave me some letters . The letters were to the Jewish brothers in the city of Damascus . I was going there to arrest the followers of Jesus and bring them back to Jerusalem for punishment .
44022006	“ But something happened to me on my way to Damascus . It was about noon when I came close to Damascus . Suddenly a bright light from heaven shined all around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? ’
44022008	“ I asked , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ The voice said , ‘ I am Jesus from Nazareth , the one you are persecuting . ’
44022009	The men who were with me did not understand the voice , but they saw the light .
44022010	“ I said , ‘ What shall I do , Lord ? ’ The Lord answered , ‘ Get up and go into Damascus . There you will be told all that I have planned for you to do . ’
44022011	I could not see , because the bright light had made me blind . So the men led me into Damascus .
44022012	“ In Damascus a man named Ananias came to me . He was a man who was devoted to God and obeyed the Law of Moses . All the Jews who lived there respected him .
44022013	He came to me and said , ‘ Saul , my brother , look up and see again ! ’ Immediately I was able to see him .
44022014	“ Ananias told me , ‘ The God of our fathers chose you long ago to know his plan . He chose you to see the Righteous One and to hear words from him .
44022015	You will be his witness to all people . You will tell them what you have seen and heard .
44022016	Now , don’t wait any longer . Get up , be baptized and wash away your sins , trusting in Jesus to save you . ’
44022017	“ Later , I came back to Jerusalem . I was praying in the Temple area , and I saw a vision .
44022018	I saw Jesus , and he said to me , ‘ Hurry and leave Jerusalem now ! The people here will not accept the truth you tell them about me . ’
44022019	“ I said , ‘ But , Lord , the people know that I was the one who put the believers in jail and beat them . I went through all the synagogues to find and arrest the people who believe in you .
44022020	The people also know that I was there when Stephen , your witness , was killed . I stood there and agreed that they should kill him . I even held the coats of the men who were killing him ! ’
44022021	“ But Jesus said to me , ‘ Leave now . I will send you far away to the non-Jewish people . ’ ”
44022022	The people stopped listening when Paul said this last thing . They all shouted , “ Get rid of this man ! He doesn’t deserve to live . ”
44022023	They kept on shouting , ripping off their clothes and throwing dust into the air .
44022024	Then the commander told the soldiers to take Paul into the army building and beat him . He wanted to make Paul tell why the people were shouting against him like this .
44022025	So the soldiers were tying Paul , preparing to beat him . But he said to an army officer there , “ Do you have the right to beat a Roman citizen who has not been proven guilty ? ”
44022026	When the officer heard this , he went to the commander and told him about it . The officer said , “ Do you know what you are doing ? This man is a Roman citizen ! ”
44022027	The commander came to Paul and said , “ Tell me , are you really a Roman citizen ? ” He answered , “ Yes . ”
44022028	The commander said , “ I paid a lot of money to become a Roman citizen . ” But Paul said , “ I was born a citizen . ”
44022029	The men who were preparing to question Paul moved away from him immediately . The commander was afraid because he had already put Paul in chains , and he was a Roman citizen .
44022030	The next day the commander decided to learn why the Jews were accusing Paul . So he ordered the leading priests and the whole high council to meet together . He had Paul’s chains taken off and had him brought in to face the council .
44023001	Paul looked at the council members and said , “ Brothers , I have lived my life in a good way before God . I have always done what I thought was right . ”
44023002	Ananias , the high priest , was there . When he heard this , he told the men who were standing near Paul to hit him in the mouth .
44023003	Paul said to Ananias , “ God will hit you too ! You are like a dirty wall that has been painted white . You sit there and judge me , using the Law of Moses . But you are telling them to hit me , and that is against the law . ”
44023004	The men standing near Paul said to him , “ Are you sure you want to insult God’s high priest like that ? ”
44023005	Paul said , “ Brothers , I did not know this man was the high priest . The Scriptures say , ‘ You must not say bad things about a leader of your people . ’ ”
44023006	Paul knew that some of the men in the council meeting were Sadducees and some were Pharisees . So he shouted , “ My brothers , I am a Pharisee and my father was a Pharisee ! I am on trial here because I believe that people will rise from death . ”
44023007	When Paul said this , a big argument started between the Pharisees and the Sadducees . The group was divided .
44023008	( The Sadducees believe that after people die , they will not live again as an angel or as a spirit . But the Pharisees believe in both . )
44023009	All these Jews began shouting louder and louder . Some of the teachers of the law , who were Pharisees , stood up and argued , “ We find nothing wrong with this man . Maybe an angel or a spirit really did speak to him . ”
44023010	The argument turned into a fight , and the commander was afraid that the Jews would tear Paul to pieces . So he told the soldiers to go down and take Paul away from these Jews and put him in the army building .
44023011	The next night the Lord Jesus came and stood by Paul . He said , “ Be brave ! You have told people in Jerusalem about me . You must do the same in Rome . ”
44023012	The next morning some of the Jews made a plan to kill Paul . They made a promise to themselves that they would not eat or drink anything until they had killed him .
44023013	There were more than 40 of them who made this plan .
44023014	They went and talked to the leading priests and the older Jewish leaders . They said , “ We have promised ourselves that we will not eat or drink until we have killed Paul .
44023015	So this is what we want you to do : Send a message to the commander from you and the high council . Tell him you want him to bring Paul out to you . Say that you want to ask him more questions . We will be waiting to kill him while he is on the way here . ”
44023016	But Paul’s nephew heard about this plan . He went to the army building and told Paul .
44023017	Then Paul called one of the army officers and said to him , “ Take this young man to the commander . He has a message for him . ”
44023018	So the army officer brought Paul’s nephew to the commander . The officer said , “ The prisoner Paul asked me to bring this young man to you . He has something to tell you . ”
44023019	The commander led the young man to a place where they could be alone . The commander asked , “ What do you want to tell me ? ”
44023020	The young man said , “ Some Jews have decided to ask you to bring Paul down to their council meeting tomorrow . They want you to think that they plan to ask Paul more questions .
44023021	But don’t believe them ! More than 40 of them are hiding and waiting to kill him . They have all promised not to eat or drink until they have killed him . Now they are waiting for you to say yes . ”
44023022	The commander sent the young man away , telling him , “ Don’t tell anyone that you have told me about their plan . ”
44023023	Then the commander called two army officers . He said to them , “ I need some men to go to Caesarea . Get 200 soldiers ready . Also , get 70 soldiers on horses and 200 men to carry spears . Be ready to leave at nine o’clock tonight .
44023024	Get some horses for Paul to ride so that he can be taken to Governor Felix safely . ”
44023025	The commander wrote a letter that said :
44023031	The soldiers did what they were told . They got Paul and took him to the city of Antipatris that night .
44023032	The next day the soldiers on horses went with Paul to Caesarea , but the other soldiers and the spearmen went back to the army building in Jerusalem .
44023033	The soldiers on horses entered Caesarea , gave the letter to Governor Felix , and then turned Paul over to him .
44023034	The governor read the letter and asked Paul , “ What country are you from ? ” The governor learned that Paul was from Cilicia .
44023035	The governor said , “ I will hear your case when the Jews who are accusing you come here too . ” Then the governor gave orders for Paul to be kept in the palace built by Herod .
44024001	Five days later Ananias , the high priest , went to the city of Caesarea . He brought with him some of the older Jewish leaders and a lawyer named Tertullus . They went to Caesarea to make charges against Paul before the governor .
44024004	But I don’t want to take any more of your time . So I will say only a few words . Please be patient .
44024005	This man is a troublemaker . He causes trouble with the Jews everywhere in the world . He is a leader of the Nazarene group .
44024009	The other Jews agreed and said it was all true .
44024010	The governor made a sign for Paul to speak . So Paul answered , “ Governor Felix , I know that you have been a judge over this nation for a long time . So I am happy to defend myself before you .
44024011	I went to worship in Jerusalem only twelve days ago . You can learn for yourself that this is true .
44024012	These Jews who are accusing me did not find me arguing with anyone at the Temple or making trouble with the people . And I was not making trouble or arguing in the synagogues or any other place in the city .
44024013	These men cannot prove the things they are saying against me now .
44024014	“ But I will tell you this : I worship the God of our fathers as a follower of the Way , which these Jews say is not the right way , and I believe everything that is taught in the Law of Moses and all that is written in the books of the prophets .
44024015	I have the same hope in God that these Jews have — the hope that all people , good and bad , will be raised from death .
44024016	This is why I always try to do what I believe is right before God and before everyone .
44024019	But some Jews from Asia were there . They should be here , standing before you . If I have really done anything wrong , they are the ones who should accuse me . They were there !
44024020	Ask these men here if they found any wrong in me when I stood before the high council meeting in Jerusalem .
44024021	I did say one thing when I stood before them and shouted , ‘ You are judging me today because I believe that people will rise from death ! ’ ”
44024022	Felix already understood a lot about the Way . He stopped the trial and said , “ When commander Lysias comes here , I will decide what to do with you . ”
44024023	Felix told the army officer to keep Paul guarded but to give him some freedom and to let his friends bring whatever he needed .
44024024	After a few days Felix came with his wife Drusilla , who was a Jew . Felix asked for Paul to be brought to him . He listened to Paul talk about believing in Christ Jesus .
44024025	But Felix became afraid when Paul spoke about things like doing right , self-control , and the judgment that will come in the future . He said , “ Go away now . When I have more time , I will call for you . ”
44024026	But Felix had another reason for talking with Paul . He hoped Paul would pay him a bribe , so he sent for Paul often and talked with him .
44024027	But after two years , Porcius Festus became governor . So Felix was no longer governor . But he left Paul in prison to please the Jews .
44025001	Festus became governor , and three days later he went from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
44025002	The leading priests and the important Jewish leaders made charges against Paul before Festus .
44025003	They asked Festus to do them a favor . They wanted him to send Paul back to Jerusalem because they had a plan to kill Paul on the way .
44025004	But Festus answered , “ No , Paul will be kept in Caesarea . I will be going there soon myself ,
44025005	and your leaders can go with me . If this man has really done anything wrong , they can accuse him there . ”
44025006	Festus stayed in Jerusalem another eight or ten days and then went back to Caesarea . The next day Festus told the soldiers to bring Paul before him . Festus was seated on the judgment seat .
44025007	Paul came into the room , and the Jews who had come from Jerusalem stood around him . They made many serious charges against him , but they could not prove anything .
44025008	Paul defended himself , saying , “ I have done nothing wrong against the Jewish law , against the Temple , or against Caesar . ”
44025009	But Festus wanted to please the Jews . So he asked Paul , “ Do you want to go to Jerusalem for me to judge you there on these charges ? ”
44025010	Paul said , “ I am standing at Caesar’s judgment seat now . This is where I should be judged . I have done nothing wrong to the Jews , and you know it .
44025011	If I have done something wrong and the law says I must die , then I agree that I should die . I don’t ask to be saved from death . But if these charges are not true , then no one can hand me over to these people . No , I want Caesar to hear my case ! ”
44025012	Festus talked about this with his advisors . Then he said , “ You have asked to see Caesar , so you will go to Caesar ! ”
44025013	A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice came to Caesarea to visit Festus .
44025014	They stayed there many days , and Festus told the king about Paul’s case . Festus said , “ There is a man that Felix left in prison .
44025015	When I went to Jerusalem , the leading priests and the older Jewish leaders there made charges against him . They wanted me to order his death .
44025016	But I told them , ‘ When a man is accused of doing something wrong , Romans don’t hand him over for others to judge . First , he must face the people accusing him . And then he must be allowed to defend himself against their charges . ’
44025017	“ So when these Jews came here for the trial , I did not waste time . The next day I sat on the judgment seat and ordered Paul to be brought in .
44025018	The Jews stood up and accused him . But they did not accuse him of the kind of crimes I thought they would .
44025019	Their charges were all about their own religion and about a man named Jesus . Jesus died , but Paul said that he is still alive .
44025020	I did not have any idea about how to judge these matters . So I asked Paul , ‘ Do you want to go to Jerusalem and be judged there ? ’
44025021	But Paul asked to be kept in Caesarea . He wants a decision from the emperor . So I ordered that he be held until I could send him to Caesar in Rome . ”
44025022	Agrippa said to Festus , “ I would like to hear this man too . ” Festus said , “ Tomorrow you can hear him . ”
44025023	The next day Agrippa and Bernice came to the meeting with great show , acting like very important people . They entered the room with military leaders and important men of the city . Festus ordered the soldiers to bring Paul in .
44025024	Festus said , “ King Agrippa and all of you gathered here with us , you see this man . All the Jewish people , here and in Jerusalem , have complained to me about him . When they complain about him , they shout that he should be killed .
44025025	When I judged him , I did not find him guilty of any crime worthy of death . But he asked to be judged by Caesar , so I decided to send him to Rome .
44025026	However , I don’t really know what to tell Caesar that this man has done wrong . So I have brought him before all of you — especially you , King Agrippa . I hope that you can question him and give me something to write to Caesar .
44025027	I think it is foolish to send a prisoner to Caesar without making some charges against him . ”
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , “ You may now speak to defend yourself . ” Paul raised his hand to get their attention and began to speak .
44026002	He said , “ King Agrippa , I feel fortunate that I can stand here before you today and answer all the charges these Jews have made against me .
44026003	I am very happy to talk to you , because you know so much about all the Jewish customs and the things the Jews argue about . Please listen to me patiently .
44026004	“ All the Jews know about my whole life . They know the way I lived from the beginning in my own country and later in Jerusalem .
44026005	These Jews have known me for a long time . If they want to , they can tell you that I was a good Pharisee . And the Pharisees obey the laws of the Jewish religion more carefully than any other group .
44026006	Now I am on trial because I hope for the promise that God made to our fathers .
44026007	This is the promise that all the twelve tribes of our people hope to receive . For this hope the Jews serve God day and night . My king , the Jews have accused me because I hope for this same promise .
44026008	Why do you people think it is impossible for God to raise people from death ?
44026009	“ I used to think that I should do everything I could against Jesus from Nazareth .
44026010	And that’s what I did , beginning in Jerusalem . The leading priests gave me the authority to put many of God’s people in jail . And when they were being killed , I agreed that it was a good thing .
44026011	I visited all the synagogues and punished them , trying to make them curse Jesus . My anger against these people was so strong that I went to other cities to find them and punish them .
44026012	“ One time the leading priests gave me permission and the authority to go to the city of Damascus .
44026013	On the way there , at noon , I saw a light from heaven , brighter than the sun . It shined all around me and those traveling with me .
44026014	We all fell to the ground . Then I heard a voice talking to me in Aramaic . The voice said , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? You are only hurting yourself by fighting me . ’
44026015	“ I said , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ “ The Lord said , ‘ I am Jesus . I am the one you are persecuting .
44026016	Stand up ! I have chosen you to be my servant . You will tell people about me — what you have seen today and what I will show you . This is why I have come to you .
44026017	I will keep you safe from your own people and from the non-Jewish people , the ones I am sending you to .
44026018	You will make them able to understand the truth . They will turn away from darkness to the light . They will turn away from the power of Satan , and they will turn to God . Then their sins can be forgiven , and they can be given a place among God’s people — those who have been made holy by believing in me . ’ ”
44026019	Paul continued speaking : “ King Agrippa , after I had this vision from heaven , I obeyed it .
44026020	I began telling people to change their hearts and lives and turn back to God . And I told them to do what would show that they had really changed . I went first to people in Damascus . Then I went to Jerusalem and to every part of Judea and told the people there . I also went to the non-Jewish people .
44026021	“ This is why the Jews grabbed me and were trying to kill me at the Temple .
44026022	But God helped me , and he is still helping me today . With God’s help I am standing here today and telling all people what I have seen . But I am saying nothing new . I am saying only what Moses and the prophets said would happen .
44026023	They said that the Messiah would die and be the first to rise from death . They said that he would bring the light of God’s saving truth to the Jewish people and to the non-Jewish people . ”
44026024	While Paul was still defending himself , Festus shouted , “ Paul , you are out of your mind ! Too much study has made you crazy . ”
44026025	Paul said , “ Most Honorable Festus , I am not crazy . What I am saying is true . It all makes perfect sense .
44026026	King Agrippa knows about all this , and I can speak freely to him . I know that he has heard about these things , because they happened where everyone could see them .
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe what the prophets wrote ? I know you believe ! ”
44026028	King Agrippa said to Paul , “ Do you think you can persuade me to become a ‘ Christ-follower ’ so easily ? ”
44026029	Paul said , “ It is not important if it is easy or if it is hard . I pray to God that not only you but that everyone listening to me today could be saved and be just like me — except for these chains I have ! ”
44026030	King Agrippa , Governor Festus , Bernice , and all the people sitting with them stood up
44026031	and left the room . They were talking to each other . They said , “ This man has done nothing worthy of being put to death or even put in jail . ”
44026032	And Agrippa said to Festus , “ We could let him go free , but he has asked to see Caesar . ”
44027001	It was decided that we would sail for Italy . An army officer named Julius , who served in the emperor’s special army , was put in charge of guarding Paul and some other prisoners on the trip .
